questions.questionContent: The default value of a static integer variable of a class in Java is

answers.answerContent: Garbage value
Null
more classes inheriting from one super class
one class inheriting from more super classes
more classes inheriting from more super classes
None of the above

questions.questionContent: Which statement is not true in java language?

answers.answerContent: A public member of a class can be accessed in all the packages.
A private member of a class cannot be accessed by the methods of the same class.
A private member of a class cannot be accessed from its derived class.
A protected member of a class can be accessed from its derived class.
None of the above

questions.questionContent: To prevent any method from overriding, we declare the method as

answers.answerContent: static
const
final
abstract
None of the above

questions.questionContent: Which one of the following is not true?

answers.answerContent: A class containing abstract methods is called an abstract class.
Abstract methods should be implemented in the derived class.
An abstract class cannot have non-abstract methods.
A class must be qualified as ‘abstract’ class, if it contains one abstract method.
None of the above
